sentences.sContent: As an idealist, I know that everyone is different, and there are many reasons why people behave the way they do.
sentences.sContent_eng: As an idealist, I know that everyone is different, and there are many reasons why people behave the way they do.
sentences.sCn: 作为一个理想主义者，我知道每人都不同，我理解人们的表现都有各自的原因。

sentences.sContent: The statement comes amid praise for Snowden in the government-controlled media that is describing him as an "idealist" and a "hero".
sentences.sContent_eng: The statement comes amid praise for Snowden in the government-controlled media that is describing him as an "idealist" and a "hero".
sentences.sCn: 作出这份声明的同时，政府控制的媒体大肆赞扬斯诺登，将其描述为“理想主义者”和“英雄”。

sentences.sContent: Walter Redlich: I'm proud to be an idealist because it shows that I believe in mankind. That may sound naive but every other belief will lead to destruction.
sentences.sContent_eng: Walter Redlich: I'm proud to be an idealist because it shows that I believe in mankind. That may sound naive but every other belief will lead to destruction.
sentences.sCn: 我为成为一个理想主义者而感到自豪，因为那说明我信仰人类。那听起来可能很天真，但是其他别的信仰将会导致毁灭。

synos.tran: 空想家，理想主义者；唯心主义者

理想主义的；唯心论的；唯心主义者的；空想家的
唯心主义，理想主义；理念论

trans.tranOther: someone who tries to live according to high standards or principles, especially in a way that is not practical or possible
